Description:
AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO HELP STATES IMPLEMENT IDENTIFIED RECOMMENDATIONS IN AREAS THE STATE NEEDS TO CHANGE/CORRECT TO MEET ARPA GOALS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
STATES MUST COMPLETE AN ASSESSMENT THAT LEVERAGES A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH RELATED TO IDENTIFYING PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS AND IMPLEMENT NEGOTIATED RECOMMENDATIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENT'S TIGER TEAM ENGAGEMENT/ASSESSMENT.

DELIVERABLES
DETECT AND PREVENT FRAUD, PROMOTE EQUITABLE ACCESS, AND ENSURE THE TIMELY PAYMENT OF BENEFITS (INCLUDING REDUCTION/ELIMINATION OF ADJUDICATION AND APPEALS BACKLOGS).  

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
NOT APPLICABLE

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE DISASTER UNEMPLOYMENT ASSISTANCE (DUA) BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED WORKERS OR UNEMPLOYED SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AS DEFINED AT 20 CFR 625.2 AND THAT THE UNEMPLOYMENT IS CAUSED BY A MAJOR DISASTER AS PROVIDED IN 20 CFR 625.5. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PROVIDE DUA BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER AND ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BUT MEET THE DUA QUALIFYING REQUIREMENTS.     

DELIVERABLES
THE DUA PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY PARTIAL INCOME REPLACEMENT SO INDIVIDUALS UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER CAN PROVIDE FOR THE NECESSITIES OF LIVING.  

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
UNEMPLOYED OR PARTIALLY UNEMPLOYED WORKERS, OR SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER OR HAVE BEEN PREVENTED FROM COMMENCING EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT. THIS INCLUDES INDIVIDUALS WHO RESIDE IN THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA BUT ARE UNABLE TO REACH THEIR PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT OUTSIDE OF THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA, AND INDIVIDUALS WHO MUST TRAVEL THROUGH A MAJOR DISASTER AREA TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT, BUT WHO ARE UNABLE TO DO SO AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USES BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PARTICIPATING STATES MUST USE INTERVENTIONS AND STRATEGIES THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY EVIDENCE AND PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN HELPING RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFITS RETURN TO WORK.  ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. REDUCE UI DURATION THROUGH IMPROVED EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES; 2. STRENGTHEN UI PROGRAM INTEGRITY; 3. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.

DELIVERABLES
RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS' DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. 

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

NOT APPLICABLE

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT RESULT IN INCREASED EQUITY IN ACCESS AND, WHEN ELIGIBLE, UI BENEFIT RECEIPT.   

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
ACTIVITIES WILL CENTER AROUND IMPROVING AWARENESS OF THE PROGRAM, ESPECIALLY IN COMMUNITIES WITH BARRIERS TO ACCESS; IMPROVING SERVICE DELIVERY THROUGH THE APPLICATION PROCESS AND IN GENERAL; AND DEVELOPING A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE EQUITY CHALLENGES THAT NEED TO BE ADDRESSED.

DELIVERABLES
OUTCOMES WILL BE NEGOTIATED AS PART OF THE GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS PRIOR TO THE APPROVAL OF FUNDS AND MAY INCLUDE PERFORMANCE MEASURES DISAGGREGATED BY DEMOGRAPHIC GROUP, SUCH AS RECIPIENCY RATE, TIMELINESS OF ISSUING PAYMENTS, AND QUALITY OF BENEFIT ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS.   

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
NOT APPLICABLE

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO ADMINISTER THE STATE'S UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
FUNDING PROVIDED TO THE STATE IS FOR COSTS INCURRED FOR THE OPERATION OF THEIR UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE PROGRAM.  THIS INCLUDES THE STATE'S UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE ADMINISTRATIVE WORKLOAD AND THEIR ABILITY TO PROCESS CLAIMS.  THIS ALSO INCLUDES THE OPERATION OF THE STATE'S CLAIMANT SYSTEMS AS WELL AS STAFFING LEVELS AND OVERHEAD COSTS.  


DELIVERABLES
THE STATE IS ABLE TO MAINTAIN OR IMPROVE LEVELS OF PERFORMANCE REGARDING THE TIMELINESS AND QUALITY OF PROCESSING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE CLAIMS, AS WELL AS EFFECTIVELY HANDLE IMPROPER PAYMENTS.  THE STATE'S ABILITY TO IDENTIFY FRAUDULENT CLAIMS AND REDUCE IMPROPER PAYMENT RATES IS MAINTAINED OR IMPROVED.


INTENDED BENEFICIARY
UNEMPLOYED CLAIMANTS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
FUNDING PROVIDED TO THE STATE IS FOR COSTS INCURRED FOR THE OPERATION OF THEIR UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE PROGRAM.  THIS INCLUDES THE STATE'S UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE ADMINISTRATIVE WORKLOAD AND THEIR ABILITY TO PROCESS CLAIMS.  THIS ALSO INCLUDES THE OPERATION OF THE STATE'S CLAIMANT SYSTEMS AS WELL AS STAFFING LEVELS AND OVERHEAD COSTS.  


DELIVERABLES
THE STATE IS ABLE TO MAINTAIN OR IMPROVE LEVELS OF PERFORMANCE REGARDING THE TIMELINESS AND QUALITY OF PROCESSING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE CLAIMS, AS WELL AS EFFECTIVELY HANDLE IMPROPER PAYMENTS.  THE STATE'S ABILITY TO IDENTIFY FRAUDULENT CLAIMS AND REDUCE IMPROPER PAYMENT RATES IS MAINTAINED OR IMPROVED.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
UNEMPLOYED CLAIMANTS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO PROVIDE TRADE ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE (TRA) AND ALTERNATIVE TRADE ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE (ATAA), AND REEMPLOYMENT TRADE ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE (RTAA) BENEFITS SUPPORT TO INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE EXHAUSTED UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION AND WHOSE JOBS WERE AFFECTED BY FOREIGN IMPORTS AS DETERMINED BY A CERTIFICATION OF GROUP COVERAGE ISSUED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PROVIDE TRA, ATAA, OR RTAA BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AND HAVE EXHAUSTED UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION AND WHOSE JOBS WERE AFFECTED BY FOREIGN IMPORTS BUT MEET THE DETERMINED CERTIFICATION OF GROUP COVERAGE ISSUED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR.

DELIVERABLES

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE DISASTER UNEMPLOYMENT ASSISTANCE (DUA) BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED WORKERS OR UNEMPLOYED SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AS DEFINED AT 20 CFR 625.2 AND THAT THE UNEMPLOYMENT IS CAUSED BY A MAJOR DISASTER AS PROVIDED IN 20 CFR 625.5. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PROVIDE DUA BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER AND ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BUT MEET THE DUA QUALIFYING REQUIREMENTS.     

DELIVERABLES
THE DUA PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY PARTIAL INCOME REPLACEMENT SO INDIVIDUALS UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER CAN PROVIDE FOR THE NECESSITIES OF LIVING.  

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
 UNEMPLOYED OR PARTIALLY UNEMPLOYED WORKERS, OR SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER OR HAVE BEEN PREVENTED FROM COMMENCING EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT. THIS INCLUDES INDIVIDUALS WHO RESIDE IN THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA BUT ARE UNABLE TO REACH THEIR PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT OUTSIDE OF THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA, AND INDIVIDUALS WHO MUST TRAVEL THROUGH A MAJOR DISASTER AREA TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT, BUT WHO ARE UNABLE TO DO SO AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO PROVIDE TRADE ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE (TRA) AND ALTERNATIVE TRADE ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE (ATAA), AND REEMPLOYMENT TRADE ADJUSTMENT ASSISTANCE (RTAA) BENEFITS SUPPORT TO INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE EXHAUSTED UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION AND WHOSE JOBS WERE AFFECTED BY FOREIGN IMPORTS AS DETERMINED BY A CERTIFICATION OF GROUP COVERAGE ISSUED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PROVIDE TRA, ATAA, OR RTAA BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AND HAVE EXHAUSTED UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION AND WHOSE JOBS WERE AFFECTED BY FOREIGN IMPORTS BUT MEET THE DETERMINED CERTIFICATION OF GROUP COVERAGE ISSUED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR.

DELIVERABLES

NOT APPLICABLE

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
NOT APPLICABLE

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE DISASTER UNEMPLOYMENT ASSISTANCE (DUA) BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED WORKERS OR UNEMPLOYED SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AS DEFINED AT 20 CFR 625.2 AND THAT THE UNEMPLOYMENT IS CAUSED BY A MAJOR DISASTER AS PROVIDED IN 20 CFR 625.5. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PROVIDE DUA BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER AND ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BUT MEET THE DUA QUALIFYING REQUIREMENTS.  

DELIVERABLES
THE DUA PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY PARTIAL INCOME REPLACEMENT SO INDIVIDUALS UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER CAN PROVIDE FOR THE NECESSITIES OF LIVING.  

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
UNEMPLOYED OR PARTIALLY UNEMPLOYED WORKERS, OR SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER OR HAVE BEEN PREVENTED FROM COMMENCING EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT. THIS INCLUDES INDIVIDUALS WHO RESIDE IN THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA BUT ARE UNABLE TO REACH THEIR PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT OUTSIDE OF THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA, AND INDIVIDUALS WHO MUST TRAVEL THROUGH A MAJOR DISASTER AREA TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT, BUT WHO ARE UNABLE TO DO SO AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO HELP STATES IMPLEMENT IDENTIFIED RECOMMENDATIONS IN AREAS THE STATE NEEDS TO CHANGE/CORRECT TO MEET ARPA GOALS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
STATES MUST COMPLETE AN ASSESSMENT THAT LEVERAGES A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH RELATED TO IDENTIFYING PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS AND IMPLEMENT NEGOTIATED RECOMMENDATIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENT'S TIGER TEAM ENGAGEMENT/ASSESSMENT.

DELIVERABLES
DETECT AND PREVENT FRAUD, PROMOTE EQUITABLE ACCESS, AND ENSURE THE TIMELY PAYMENT OF BENEFITS (INCLUDING REDUCTION/ELIMINATION OF ADJUDICATION AND APPEALS BACKLOGS).  

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO ALLOW COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO HELP WORKERS APPLY FOR, AND IF ELIGIBLE, RECEIVE UI BENEFITS AND RELATED SERVICES AND BENEFITS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
OUTREACH, TRAINING, AND SERVICE DELIVERY TO HELP WORKERS APPLY FOR AND, IF ELIGIBLE, RECEIVE UI BENEFITS AND RELATED SERVICES AND BENEFITS.


DELIVERABLES
THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO INCREASE ACCESS TO BENEFITS, PARTICULARLY IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, SUBSEQUENT WORK ATTACHMENT, AND OVERALL COMMUNITY FAMILIARITY AND COMFORT WITH UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION.  THE RESULTS OF THESE PILOT GRANTS WILL DETERMINE FUTURE GRANT OPPORTUNITIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO ALLOW COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO HELP WORKERS APPLY FOR, AND IF ELIGIBLE, RECEIVE UI BENEFITS AND RELATED SERVICES AND BENEFITS.


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
OUTREACH, TRAINING, AND SERVICE DELIVERY TO HELP WORKERS APPLY FOR AND, IF ELIGIBLE, RECEIVE UI BENEFITS AND RELATED SERVICES AND BENEFITS.

DELIVERABLES
THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO INCREASE ACCESS TO BENEFITS, PARTICULARLY IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, SUBSEQUENT WORK ATTACHMENT, AND OVERALL COMMUNITY FAMILIARITY AND COMFORT WITH UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION.  THE RESULTS OF THESE PILOT GRANTS WILL DETERMINE FUTURE GRANT OPPORTUNITIES.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES, WHICH WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IDENTIFICATION OF TRENDS AND ACCESS ISSUES TO BE ADDRESSED, AND WORKERS, WHO HAVE HISTORICALLY ENCOUNTERED BARRIERS TO ACCESS, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, INDIVIDUALS WHO LACK ACCESS DUE TO THEIR RACE OR ETHNICITY, LOW WAGE WORKERS, OR INDIVIDUALS WITH LIMITED ENGLISH LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
OUTREACH, TRAINING, AND SERVICE DELIVERY TO WORKERS TO HELP THEM APPLY FOR AND, IF ELIGIBLE, RECEIVE UI BENEFITS AND RELATED SERVICES AND BENEFITS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO HELP STATES IMPLEMENT IDENTIFIED RECOMMENDATIONS IN AREAS THE STATE NEEDS TO CHANGE/CORRECT TO MEET ARPA GOALS.



ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
STATES MUST COMPLETE AN ASSESSMENT THAT LEVERAGES A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH RELATED TO IDENTIFYING PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS AND IMPLEMENT NEGOTIATED RECOMMENDATIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENT'S TIGER TEAM ENGAGEMENT/ASSESSMENT.

DELIVERABLES
DETECT AND PREVENT FRAUD, PROMOTE EQUITABLE ACCESS, AND ENSURE THE TIMELY PAYMENT OF BENEFITS (INCLUDING REDUCTION/ELIMINATION OF ADJUDICATION AND APPEALS BACKLOGS).

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE DISASTER UNEMPLOYMENT ASSISTANCE (DUA) BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED WORKERS OR UNEMPLOYED SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AS DEFINED AT 20 CFR 625.2 AND THAT THE UNEMPLOYMENT IS CAUSED BY A MAJOR DISASTER AS PROVIDED IN 20 CFR 625.5. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PROVIDE DUA BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER AND ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BUT MEET THE DUA QUALIFYING REQUIREMENTS.     

DELIVERABLES
THE DUA PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY PARTIAL INCOME REPLACEMENT SO INDIVIDUALS UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER CAN PROVIDE FOR THE NECESSITIES OF LIVING.  

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
UNEMPLOYED OR PARTIALLY UNEMPLOYED WORKERS, OR SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER OR HAVE BEEN PREVENTED FROM COMMENCING EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT. THIS INCLUDES INDIVIDUALS WHO RESIDE IN THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA BUT ARE UNABLE TO REACH THEIR PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT OUTSIDE OF THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA, AND INDIVIDUALS WHO MUST TRAVEL THROUGH A MAJOR DISASTER AREA TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT, BUT WHO ARE UNABLE TO DO SO AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
NOT APPLICABLE

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USED BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PARTICIPATING STATES MUST USE INTERVENTIONS AND STRATEGIES THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY EVIDENCE AND PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN HELPING RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFITS RETURN TO WORK.  ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. REDUCE UI DURATION THROUGH IMPROVED EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES; 2. STRENGTHEN UI PROGRAM INTEGRITY; 3. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.

DELIVERABLES
RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS' DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM TO QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. 

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USES BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PARTICIPATING STATES MUST USE INTERVENTIONS AND STRATEGIES THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY EVIDENCE AND PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN HELPING RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFITS RETURN TO WORK.  ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. REDUCE UI DURATION THROUGH IMPROVED EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES; 2. STRENGTHEN UI PROGRAM INTEGRITY; 3. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.

DELIVERABLES
RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS' DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. 

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES

 RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS' DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM TO QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. 

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USES BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PARTICIPATING STATES MUST USE INTERVENTIONS AND STRATEGIES THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY EVIDENCE AND PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN HELPING RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFITS RETURN TO WORK.  ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. REDUCE UI DURATION THROUGH IMPROVED EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES; 2. STRENGTHEN UI PROGRAM INTEGRITY; 3. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.

ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. REDUCE UI DURATION THROUGH IMPROVED EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES; 2. STRENGTHEN UI PROGRAM INTEGRITY; 3. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.

DELIVERABLES
RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS' DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM TO QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
 INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. 

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USED BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USED BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS' CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS. 

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
PARTICIPATING STATES MUST USE INTERVENTIONS AND STRATEGIES THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY EVIDENCE AND PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN HELPING RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFITS RETURN TO WORK.  ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. REDUCE UI DURATION THROUGH IMPROVED EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES; 2. STRENGTHEN UI PROGRAM INTEGRITY; 3. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING PROGRAMS; AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.

 RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS' DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM TO QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

AWARD PURPOSE
THE FISCAL YEAR (FY) 2022 APPROPRIATED FUNDS 
WILL SUPPORT THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING ADMINISTRATION 
(ETA) AND THE CENTER FOR EMPLOYMENT SECURITY EDUCATION AND RESEARCH (CESER) FOR CONTINUED 
SUPPORT AND OPERATION OF THE UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) INTEGRITY CENTER OF EXCELLENCE 
(INTEGRITY CENTER). CESER, A 501(C)(3) ENTITY, INCORPORATED IN AUGUST 1994 AS AN EDUCATION AND 
RESEARCH ARM OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES (NASWA), IS A NATIONAL 
ORGANIZATION OF STATE ADMINISTRATORS OF THE PUBLICLY-FUNDED STATE WORKFORCE SYSTEM AND A LEADING 
PROVIDER OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY (IT), EDUCATION, AND RESEARCH SUPPORT FOCUSED EXCLUSIVELY ON 
UI AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES AND ACTIVITIES. 
CESER, AS A SUBSIDIARY OF NASWA, IS UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO PROVIDE A FORUM FOR STATES TO 
EXCHANGE INFORMATION AND IDEAS RELATED TO PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS AND PEER-TO-PEER COLLABORATION 
TO HELP ENSURE THE INTEGRITY OF UI PROGRAM OPERATIONS. NASWA/CESER FOSTERS AND SUPPORTS 
RELATIONSHIPS TO HELP ENSURE PROGRAM INTEGRITY AND QUALITY PERFORMANCE OF THE UI SYSTEM 
NATIONWIDE. NASWA/CESER ALSO SERVES AS A LIAISON BETWEEN STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES, ETA 
AND OTHER FEDERAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES, CONGRESS, BUSINESS, LABOR, AND INTERGOVERNMENTAL 
GROUPS. NASWA SERVES AS THE COLLECTIVE VOICE OF STATE AGENCIES ON UI MATTERS, AND THROUGH ITS 
SUBSIDIARY, CESER, PROVIDES AND/OR FACILITATES EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND IT SUPPORT FOR THE UI 
PROGRAM NATIONWIDE. NASWA/CESER IS A TRUSTED BROKER TO SUPPORT STATES RECEIPT OF TECHNICAL 
ASSISTANCE TOOLS AND RESOURCES TO IMPROVE PROGRAM INTEGRITY.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
THE UI INTEGRITY CENTER ACTIVITIES AND PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT, PRODUCT SUPPORT ACTIVITIES, FUNCTIONS, 
AND/OR PROJECTS REFERRED TO AS UI INTEGRITY CENTER CORE ACTIVITIES ARE ADDRESSED IN THE COOPERATIVE 
AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE US DEPARTMENT OF LABOR (USDOL) AND THE NASWA/CESER. THE 
ACTIVITIES/DELIVERABLES OUTLINED IN THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ARE ESTABLISHED TO MEET ETA'S NEEDS 
TO SUPPORT THE STATE UI AGENCIES IN IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIES TO ENSURE PROGRAM INTEGRITY; TO
PREVENT, DETECT, AND RECOVER IMPROPER PAYMENTS; AND TO REDUCE FRAUD IN THE UI PROGRAM.



DELIVERABLES
THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED BY CESER TO PERFORM WORK CONSISTENT WITH THE SCOPE OF WORK AND DELIVERABLES/OUTCOMES INCLUDED IN THE CURRENT COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. 

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
THE UI INTEGRITY CENTER'S STCO ACTS AS A BOARD OF GOVERNORS, WHICH PROVIDES GUIDANCE, 
DIRECTION, AND MONITORS THE PROGRESS OF UI INTEGRITY CENTER PROJECTS. THE UI INTEGRITY CENTER'S 
STCO IS CURRENTLY COMPRISED OF VOTING MEMBERS FROM:
• USDOL'S OFFICE OF UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (OUI),
• THE NASWA BOARD OF DIRECTORS
• THE NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR (NYSDOL), AND
• STATE UI DIRECTORS (OR EQUIVALENTS).
ETA/OUI REPRESENTS TWO SEATS ON THE UI INTEGRITY CENTER STCO, WHICH IS THE GOVERNANCE, 
STRATEGIC PLANNING, AND OVERSIGHT ENTITY FOR THE UI INTEGRITY CENTER. ANY PROJECT INITIATED BY THE 
UI INTEGRITY CENTER MUST BE APPROVED BY THE UI INTEGRITY CENTER STCO

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
Y

AWARD PURPOSE
UNDER THE TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, UDWS WILL TAKE NECESSARY ACTIONS, UNDER THE RULES AND REGULATIONS
PRESCRIBED BY THE STATE OF UTAH, TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH ETA TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT AND
HOSTING OF UI TRAINING. ETA WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND DIRECTION TO THE PROJECT AND WILL MONITOR THE
PROJECT IN CONJUNCTION WITH AN UI TRAINING EXECUTIVE OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE (EOC).
THE EOC IS COMPRISED OF THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE OFFICE OF UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE AND DESIGNATED
ETA STAFF; A DESIGNATED MEMBER OF UDWS MANAGEMENT OR UDWS MANAGEMENT'S DESIGNEE; AND THE
EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, OR HIS OR HER DESIGNEE, OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES
(NASWA), CENTER FOR EMPLOYMENT SECURITY EDUCATION AND RESEARCH (CESER). THE EOC PROVIDES
OVERSIGHT OF TRAINING ACTIVITIES CARRIED OUT UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF THE
ANNUAL BUDGET AND ALL TRAINING PROJECTS/ACTIVITIES. THE EOC IS CHARGED WITH DEVELOPING AN ANNUAL TRAINING
PLAN, WHICH CAN BE AMENDED AT ANY TIME BY THE EOC. THE EOC MEETS AT LEAST QUARTERLY TO REVIEW STATUS
OF PROJECTS AND FUNDING UNDER THIS AGREEMENT.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
NASWA/CESER'S ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:
BAM VIRTUAL INSTRUCTOR LED TRAINING COURSE
TASK 1: IDENTIFY TOPICS, PRODUCE CONTENT, AND COURSE MATERIALS.
PRODUCE COURSE VISUALS, INSTRUCTOR AND PARTICIPANT GUIDES.
TASK 2: CREATE PERSISTENT VILT CLASSROOM IN KALTURA, CESER'S VILT PLATFORM.
PRODUCE COURSE PLAYLIST, LOAD COURSE MATERIALS IN COURSE CHANNEL.
TASK 3: DELIVER BAM VILT THREE (3) TIMES ACCORDING TO SCHEDULE NEGOTIATED WITH US DOL.
CREATE BAM VILT REGISTRATION PORTAL IN THE NASWA LMS, ENROLL LEARNERS, PROVIDE AN INSTRUCTOR.
TASK 4: DEVELOP AND DELIVER POST-COURSE COMPLETION SURVEY AND ANALYZE RESULTS.
DEVELOP SURVEY QUESTIONS, CREATE ONLINE SURVEY INSTRUMENT, SEND SURVEY TO LEARNERS UPON COURSE
COMPLETION, ANALYZE RESULTS AND PRODUCE OUTCOME REPORT.
TASK 5: PROVIDE LEARNER COURSE COMPLETION REPORTS AS NEEDED/REQUESTED.
MAINTAIN LEARNER DEMOGRAPHIC AND COMPLETION DATA AND PROVIDE DOWNLOADABLE CERTIFICATE OF
COMPLETION.
FEDERAL STATE UC LEGISLATIVE SEMINAR COURSE
TASK 1: REVIEW ALL COURSE CONTENT, AIDS, AND COURSE MATERIALS FOR UPDATES.
TASK 2: REPUBLISH UPDATED COURSES, AIDES, AND MATERIALS TO THE LMS.
TASK 3: DEVELOP AND DELIVER POST-COURSE COMPLETION SURVEY AND ANALYZE RESULTS.
TASK 4: PROVIDE LEARNER COURSE COMPLETION REPORTS AS NEEDED/REQUESTED.
3
TASK 5: MAINTAIN LEARNER DEMOGRAPHIC AND COMPLETION DATA AND PROVIDE A DOWNLOADABLE CERTIFICATE OF
COMPLETION.
TASK 6: PROVIDE LEARNER SUPPORT FOR ONLINE AND ENHANCED SEMINAR SERIES WEBINARS.

DELIVERABLES
NASWA/CESER WILL UNDERTAKE ALL TASKS THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD OF
PERFORMANCE ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2023, AND IN ANY ADDITIONAL EXTENSION OF THIS AGREEMENT IF APPROVED BY
USDOL.
FEDERAL STATE UC LEGISLATIVE SEMINAR
1. DEVELOP TOPICS, CONTENT, AND GRAPHICS NECESSARY TO UPDATE LEGISLATIVE COURSES;
2. UPDATE LEGISLATIVE COURSE JOB AIDES, AS NEEDED;
3. UPDATE LEGISLATIVE COURSE MATERIALS, AS NEEDED;
4. DEVELOP A POST-COURSE COMPLETION ONLINE OUTCOME SURVEY;
5. AGGREGATE AND REPORT LEARNER OUTCOMES; AND,
6. MAINTAIN LEARNER DEMOGRAPHIC, ATTENDANCE, AND COMPLETION RECORDS IN THE NASWA LMS.
BAM VIRTUAL INSTRUCTOR LED TRAINING COURSE
1. DEVELOP TOPICS, CONTENT, AND GRAPHICS NECESSARY FOR THE CREATION OF THE BAM VILT;
2. PRODUCE AN INSTRUCTOR GUIDE TO ALLOW FUTURE INSTRUCTORS TO EASILY DELIVER THE COURSE;
3. PRODUCE A PARTICIPANT GUIDE TO SERVE AS A KEY TRAINING "TAKE AWAY" FOR LEARNERS;
4. DELIVER THE BAM VILT THREE (3) TIMES USING AN SME INSTRUCTOR;
5. DEVELOP A POST-COURSE COMPLETION ONLINE OUTCOME SURVEY;
6. AGGREGATE AND REPORT LEARNER OUTCOMES; AND,
7. MAINTAIN LEARNER DEMOGRAPHIC, ATTENDANCE, AND COMPLETION RECORDS IN THE NASWA LMS.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
NASWA IS THE NATIONAL ORGANIZATION REPRESENTING THE 53 STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES. THESE AGENCIES
DELIVER TRAINING, EMPLOYMENT, CAREER, AND BUSINESS SERVICES, IN ADDITION TO ADMINISTERING THE
UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE, VETERAN REEMPLOYMENT, AND LABOR MARKET INFORMATION PROGRAMS. NASWA
PROVIDES POLICY EXPERTISE, SHARES PROMISING STATE PRACTICES, AND PROMOTES STATE INNOVATION AND LEADERSHIP
IN WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT. AS A SUBSIDIARY OF NASWA, CESER SERVES AS A TRUSTED RESOURCE TO STATE UI
AGENCIES FOR RESEARCH, IDENTIFICATION OF BEST PRACTICES, TECHNICAL SUPPORT, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
INITIATIVES, PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND TRAINING.

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
Y

AWARD PURPOSE
IN 2019, USDOL AND THE UTAH DWS EXECUTED A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND HOSTING OF UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE PROGRAM TRAINING UNDER THE OVERSIGHT OF AN EXECUTIVE OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE (EOC).
UNDER THE TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, UDWS WILL TAKE NECESSARY ACTIONS, UNDER THE RULES AND REGULATIONS PRESCRIBED BY THE STATE OF UTAH, TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH ETA TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT AND HOSTING OF UI TRAINING. ETA WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND DIRECTION TO THE PROJECT AND WILL MONITOR THE PROJECT IN CONJUNCTION WITH AN UI TRAINING EXECUTIVE OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE (EOC). THE PURPOSE OF THIS REQUEST IS TO PROVIDE THE FUNDING NECESSARY TO COMPLETE AN ANALYSIS OF NEEDED CURRICULUM AND FOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND DELIVERY OF THE FIRST TRAINING MODULE FOR A COMPREHENSIVE EQUITY AND ACCESS TRAINING CURRICULUM.
THIS PROJECT WILL BE COMPLETED IN COLLABORATION WITH SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS FROM THE US DOL OUI.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
THE EOC IS COMPRISED OF THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE OFFICE OF UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE AND DESIGNATED ETA STAFF; A DESIGNATED MEMBER OF UDWS MANAGEMENT OR UDWS MANAGEMENT'S DESIGNEE; AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, OR HIS OR HER DESIGNEE, OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES (NASWA), CENTER FOR EMPLOYMENT SECURITY EDUCATION AND RESEARCH (CESER). THE EOC PROVIDES OVERSIGHT OF TRAINING ACTIVITIES CARRIED OUT UNDER THIS AGREEMENT, INCLUDING REVIEW AND APPROVAL OF THE ANNUAL BUDGET AND ALL TRAINING PROJECTS/ACTIVITIES. THE EOC IS CHARGED WITH DEVELOPING AN ANNUAL TRAINING PLAN, WHICH CAN BE AMENDED AT ANY TIME BY THE EOC. THE EOC MEETS AT LEAST QUARTERLY TO REVIEW STATUS OF PROJECTS AND FUNDING UNDER THIS AGREEMENT.
NASWA/CESER'S ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:
1.) COMPLETION OF A COMPREHENSIVE CONTENT ANALYSIS AND PLAN FOR FUTURE CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES FOR IDENTIFIED TARGET AUDIENCES;
2.) DESIGN, DEVELOP, DELIVER, AND HOST THE FIRST EQUITY & ACCESS ELEARNING LESSON, FUNDAMENTALS OF EQUITY & ACCESS IN THE UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE PROGRAM (FUNDAMENTALS LESSON).

DELIVERABLES
NASWA/CESER WILL UNDERTAKE ALL TASKS IDENTIFIED TASKS THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE ON SEPTEMBER 30, 2023, AND IN ANY ADDITIONAL EXTENSION OF THIS AGREEMENT IF APPROVED BY USDOL.NASWA/CESER'S ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:
1.) COMPLETION OF A COMPREHENSIVE CONTENT ANALYSIS AND PLAN FOR FUTURE CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES FOR IDENTIFIED TARGET AUDIENCES;
2.) DESIGN, DEVELOP, DELIVER, AND HOST THE FIRST EQUITY & ACCESS ELEARNING LESSON, FUNDAMENTALS OF EQUITY & ACCESS IN THE UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE PROGRAM (FUNDAMENTALS LESSON).

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
NASWA/CESER IS A LEADER IN PROVIDING EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SUPPORT FOCUSED ON WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT AND UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE ISSUES. CESER, A 501(C) (3) ENTITY, WAS INCORPORATED IN AUGUST 1994 AS AN ARM OF NASWA. IN SUPPORTING NASWA AND ITS PARTNERS, CESER SERVES AS AN ENTITY FOR RESEARCH, ANALYSIS, TRAINING, AND TECHNOLOGY. UNDER THE TERMS OF THIS AGREEMENT, UDWS WILL TAKE NECESSARY ACTIONS, UNDER THE RULES AND REGULATIONS PRESCRIBED BY THE STATE OF UTAH, TO WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH ETA TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT AND HOSTING OF UI TRAINING. ETA WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND DIRECTION TO THE PROJECT AND WILL MONITOR THE PROJECT IN CONJUNCTION WITH AN UI TRAINING EXECUTIVE OVERSIGHT COMMITTEE (EOC).

SEPTEMBER 27, 1994, FOLLOWING A NATIONWIDE COMPETITIVE PROCESS, THROUGH A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN
THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF LABOR (USDOL) AND THE STATE OF MARYLAND, DEPARTMENT OF LABOR
(MDOL)(FORMERLY KNOWN AS THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR, LICENSING AND REGULATION OR "DLLR"). . THE UI
ITSC IS A DIVISION OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES' (NASWA) CENTER FOR
EMPLOYMENT SECURITY EDUCATION AND RESEARCH (CESER), INC. WHICH IS A TAX EXEMPT, NONPROFIT ENTITY UNDER
SECTION 501(C) (3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. CESER IS A DIVISION OF THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF STATE
WORKFORCE AGENCIES (NASWA).

AWARD PURPOSE
THE IRORA IS AN AGREEMENT AMONG STATE AGENCIES PROVIDING AUTHORITY FOR SIGNATORY STATES TO COLLECT
OVERPAID UI BENEFITS FOR OTHER PARTICIPATING STATES. IN ADDITION, THE AGREEMENT WAS DESIGNED TO
INCORPORATE A STANDARDIZED GUIDELINE FOR STATES TO MODEL HOW THEY WILL COLLECT OVERPAYMENTS OF UI
BENEFITS FROM EACH OTHER. STATES CAN ENTER INTO SEPARATE AGREEMENTS AMONG THEMSELVES, BUT THE
IRORA GIVES STATES A STANDARDIZED APPROACH TO RECOVERING OVERPAYMENTS FOR EACH OTHER ON A
COOPERATIVE BASIS.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
NASWA/CESER'S ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:
•	ADMINISTER AND SUPPORT THE IRORA; AND ALTHOUGH THE IRORA AGREEMENT JUST WENT THROUGH A MAJOR UPDATE IN 2013, NASWA WILL IMPLEMENT ANY FUTURE MODIFICATIONS TO THE AGREEMENT THAT MAY BE REQUIRED.
•	PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SWAS REGARDING QUESTIONS AND ISSUES PERTAINING TO IRORA.
•	WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH USDOL ON UI INTERSTATE CONNECTION NETWORK APPLICATIONS THAT SUPPORT THE IRORA EFFORT SUCH AS THE ELECTRONIC IB8606 REQUEST.
•	PROVIDE KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERTISE TO SUPPORT THE IRORA THROUGH NASWA'S UI IB SUBCOMMITTEE.
•	SUPPORT THE IRORA WEBPAGE ON NASWA'S WEBSITE.
•	MAINTAIN THE IRORA USER GUIDE.
•	SUPPORT THE COMMUNICATION OF IRORA ACTIVITIES, PRODUCTS, AND DELIVERABLES TO THE UI SYSTEM USING EXISTING NASWA TECHNOLOGY AND TOOLS.

DELIVERABLES
NASWA/CESER WILL UNDERTAKE ALL TASKS IDENTIFIED ABOVE (TASKS) THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE ON JULY 31, 2023, AND IN ANY ADDITIONAL EXTENSION OF THIS GRANT IF APPROVED BY USDOL.

INTENDED BENEFICIARY
NASWA'S UI IB SUBCOMMITTEE WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH EACH PARTICIPATING STATE AGENCY TO ENSURE THAT THEY ADOPT AND PUT INTO EFFECT RULES, REGULATIONS, INSTRUCTIONS, PROCEDURAL FORMS AND INTERPRETATIVE DECISIONS RELATING TO THIS ARRANGEMENT EXCEPT WHEN INCONSISTENT WITH THE STATUTORY PROVISIONS OF ITS UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION LAW. NASWA/CESER IS STRUCTURED TO REFLECT THE FEDERAL-STATE PARTNERSHIP THAT IS THE FOUNDATION OF THE UI PROGRAM AND EXPECTS THAT ALL STATES WILL BENEFIT FROM THE MANY IRORA TOOLS.  NASWA'S ADMINISTRATION OF THE IRORA AGREEMENT WILL CREATE GREATER EFFICIENCY, IMPROVE OPERATIONS, AND SAVE MILLIONS OF TAXPAYER DOLLARS THROUGH THE UI OVERPAYMENT OFFSET REQUIREMENT 

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES
Y

AWARD PURPOSE
THE STATE INFORMATION DATA EXCHANGE SYSTEM (SIDES) IS AN AUTOMATED SYSTEM THAT ALLOWS ELECTRONIC TRANSMISSION OF INFORMATION REQUESTS FROM STATE UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) AGENCIES TO EMPLOYERS AND/OR THIRD PARTY ADMINISTRATORS (TPAS), AS WELL AS TRANSMISSION OF REPLIES CONTAINING THE REQUESTED INFORMATION BACK TO THE STATE UI AGENCIES. CONGRESS PROVIDES AUTHORITY FOR DOL TO MAKE SUBSCRIPTION PAYMENTS ON BEHALF OF STATES FOR SIDES.

ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROGRAMMING TO SUPPORT AND ENHANCE THE UI SIDES APPLICATION SOFTWARE SUITE. IT ALSO INCLUDES THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE UI SIDES SYSTEM FOR THE STATES, EMPLOYERS AND THIRD PARTY ADMINISTRATORS (TPAS) FOR BOTH SIDES WEB SERVICES AND SIDES E-RESPONSE SYSTEMS. OTHER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE NATIONAL SIDES TRAINING SEMINAR; MARKETING OF SIDES TO EMPLOYERS AND TPAS.

DELIVERABLES
MAINTAIN, OPERATE AND UPDATE THE SIDES WEB SERVICES AND E-RESPONSE SYSTEMS AND ITS VARIOUS DATA EXCHANGE MODULES.

SWAS, EMPLOYERS AND/OR TPAS

AWARD PURPOSE
THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO CREATE EQUITY IN REGISTERED APPRENTICESHIP PROGRAMS HUB (E-RAP).


ACTIVITIES PERFORMED
TWO PROGRAM GOALS ARE IMPLEMENTED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK:
PROGRAM GOAL #1: ESTABLISH A MULTIFUNCTIONAL RAP HUB;
PROGRAM GOAL #2: BECOME A STATEWIDE RESOURCE TO EXPAND EQUITABLE RAP IMPLEMENTATION SERVING UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES.
PROGRAM ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: (1) CENTRALIZED CROSS-INDUSTRY RESOURCE CENTER, (2) ROBUST EMPLOYER ENGAGEMENT, (3) INCENTIVE FUNDING, (4) EMPLOYER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE LEADING TO RAP ADOPTION, (5) NETWORK OF EQUITY-FOCUSED PARTNERS, AND (6) AN EXPANSION COHORT SUPPORTING STATEWIDE SCALING INITIATIVES.

DELIVERABLES
800 (80% FROM UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS)

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES

RESEA PROGRAM PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USES BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  PARTICIPATING STATES MUST USE INTERVENTIONS AND STRATEGIES THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY EVIDENCE AND PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN HELPING RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFITS RETURN TO WORK.  ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. REDUCE UI DURATION THROUGH IMPROVED EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES  2. STRENGTHEN UI PROGRAM INTEGRITY  3. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING PROGRAMS  AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

RESEA PROGRAM PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USES BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  PARTICIPATING STATES MUST USE INTERVENTIONS AND STRATEGIES THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY EVIDENCE AND PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN HELPING RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFITS RETURN TO WORK.  ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. RESEA PROGRAM PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE STATES WITH FUNDING TO OPERATE REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND ELIGIBILITY ASSESSMENT PROGRAMS THAT ASSIST INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) BENEFITS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REEMPLOYMENT SERVICES AND REFERRALS TO OTHER AVAILABLE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. THESE FUNDS ARE ALSO USES BY STATES TO CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF PARTICIPANTS CONTINUING ELIGIBILITY FOR UI BENEFITS. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  PARTICIPATING STATES MUST USE INTERVENTIONS AND STRATEGIES THAT ARE SUPPORTED BY EVIDENCE AND PROVEN TO BE EFFECTIVE IN HELPING RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFITS RETURN TO WORK.  ALTERNATIVELY, STATES MAY ELECT TO TEST AND EVALUATE NEW REEMPLOYMENT STRATEGIES AND INTERVENTIONS.  ALL RESEA FUNDED ACTIVITIES MUST BE ALIGNED WITH FOUR PROGRAM GOALS: 1. REDUCE UI DURATION THROUGH IMPROVED EMPLOYMENT OUTCOMES  2. STRENGTHEN UI PROGRAM INTEGRITY  3. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING PROGRAMS  AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. PROMOTE ALIGNMENT WITH THE VISION OF THE WORKFORCE INNOVATION AND OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOA) OF INTEGRATED AND SEAMLESS SERVICES ACROSS FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL WORKFORCE, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING PROGRAMS  AND 4. ESTABLISH RESEA AS AN ENTRY POINT TO OTHER WORKFORCE PROGRAMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  RESEA IS INTENDED TO SHORTEN UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS DURATION OF RECEIVING UI BENEFITS BY ASSISTING THEM QUICKLY RETURN TO WORK.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  INDIVIDUALS RECEIVING REGULAR UI BENEFITS ARE ELIGIBLE FOR RESEA AND STATES MAY FURTHER PRIORITIZE SELECTION AMONG THIS POPULATION.  IN MOST CASES, STATES TARGET RESEA SERVICES TO RECIPIENTS OF UI BENEFIT WHO HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS MOST LIKELY THE EXHAUST THEIR UI BENEFITS BEFORE BECOMING REEMPLOYED. SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  GRANTS ARE PROVIDED TO STATE AGENCIES THAT MAY PARTNER WITH LOCAL WORKFORCE SERVICE PROVIDERS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE DISASTER UNEMPLOYMENT ASSISTANCE (DUA) BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED WORKERS OR UNEMPLOYED SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AS DEFINED AT 20 CFR 625.2 AND THAT THE UNEMPLOYMENT IS CAUSED BY A MAJOR DISASTER AS PROVIDED IN 20 CFR 625.5. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  PROVIDE DUA BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER AND ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BUT MEET THE DUA QUALIFYING REQUIREMENTS.     EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE DUA PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY PARTIAL INCOME REPLACEMENT SO INDIVIDUALS UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER CAN PROVIDE FOR THE NECESSITIES OF LIVING.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  UNEMPLOYED OR PARTIALLY UNEMPLOYED WORKERS, OR SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER OR HAVE BEEN PREVENTED FROM COMMENCING EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT. THIS INCLUDES INDIVIDUALS WHO RESIDE IN THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA BUT ARE UNABLE TO REACH THEIR PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT OUTSIDE OF THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA, AND INDIVIDUALS WHO MUST TRAVEL THROUGH A MAJOR DISASTER AREA TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT, BUT WHO ARE UNABLE TO DO SO AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT RESULT IN INCREASED EQUITY IN ACCESS AND, WHEN ELIGIBLE, UI BENEFIT RECEIPT.   ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  ACTIVITIES WILL CENTER AROUND IMPROVING AWARENESS OF THE PROGRAM, ESPECIALLY IN COMMUNITIES WITH BARRIERS TO ACCESS  IMPROVING SERVICE DELIVERY THROUGH THE APPLICATION PROCESS AND IN GENERAL  AND DEVELOPING A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE EQUITY CHALLENGES THAT NEED TO BE ADDRESSED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  OUTCOMES WILL BE NEGOTIATED AS PART OF THE GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS PRIOR TO THE APPROVAL OF FUNDS AND MAY INCLUDE PERFORMANCE MEASURES DISAGGREGATED BY DEMOGRAPHIC GROUP, SUCH AS RECIPIENCY RATE, TIMELINESS OF ISSUING PAYMENTS, AND QUALITY OF BENEFIT ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS. PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO HELP STATES IMPLEMENT IDENTIFIED RECOMMENDATIONS IN AREAS THE STATE NEEDS TO CHANGE CORRECT TO MEET ARPA GOALS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  STATES MUST COMPLETE AN ASSESSMENT THAT LEVERAGES A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH RELATED TO IDENTIFYING PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS AND IMPLEMENT NEGOTIATED RECOMMENDATIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENTS TIGER TEAM ENGAGEMENT ASSESSMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  DETECT AND PREVENT FRAUD, PROMOTE EQUITABLE ACCESS, AND ENSURE THE TIMELY PAYMENT OF BENEFITS (INCLUDING REDUCTION ELIMINATION OF ADJUDICATION AND APPEALS BACKLOGS). AWARD PURPOSE  GRANT FUNDING TO SUPPORT STATES WITH FRAUD DETECTION AND PREVENTION, INCLUDING IDENTITY VERIFICATION AND OVERPAYMENT RECOVERY, IN ALL UC PROGRAMS. ACTIVITIES PERFORMED  THE DEPARTMENT PROVIDED UP TO  140 MILLION TO SWAS FOR GRANTS TO SUPPORT STATES WITH FRAUD DETECTION AND PREVENTION, INCLUDING IDENTITY VERIFICATION AND OVERPAYMENT RECOVERY ACTIVITIES, IN ALL UC PROGRAMS. STATES MAY USE THE FUNDS MADE AVAILABLE UNDER THIS UIPL TO SUPPORT INNOVATIVE STRATEGIES AND SOLUTIONS TO 1) STRENGTHEN IDENTITY VERIFICATION OF UNEMPLOYMENT INSURANCE (UI) CLAIMANTS  2) ENHANCE FRAUD DETECTION AND PREVENTION STRATEGIES  3) IMPROVE DATA MANAGEMENT AND ANALYTIC CAPABILITIES  4) INCREASE CYBERSECURITY  AND 5) EXPAND OVERPAYMENT RECOVERY EFFORTS.DELIVERABLES  STATES MAY USE THE FUNDS MADE AVAILABLE UNDER THIS UIPL TO STRENGTHEN IDENTITY VERIFICATION OF UI CLAIMANTS, ENHANCE FRAUD DETECTION AND PREVENTION STRATEGIES, IMPROVE DATA MANAGEMENT AND ANALYTIC CAPABILITIES, INCREASE CYBERSECURITY, AND EXPAND OVERPAYMENT RECOVERY EFFORTS IN ALL UC PROGRAMS.INTENDED BENEFICIARY  STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES (SWAS), AND INDIVIDUALS (CLAIMANTS) FROM IDENTITY THEFTSUBRECIP ACTIVITIES  NONE

PURPOSE  THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO CONDUCT ACTIVITIES THAT RESULT IN INCREASED EQUITY IN ACCESS AND, WHEN ELIGIBLE, UI BENEFIT RECEIPT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  ACTIVITIES WILL CENTER AROUND IMPROVING AWARENESS OF THE PROGRAM, ESPECIALLY IN COMMUNITIES WITH BARRIERS TO ACCESS  IMPROVING SERVICE DELIVERY THROUGH THE APPLICATION PROCESS AND IN GENERAL  AND DEVELOPING A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE EQUITY CHALLENGES THAT NEED TO BE ADDRESSED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES  OUTCOMES WILL BE NEGOTIATED AS PART OF THE GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS PRIOR TO THE APPROVAL OF FUNDS AND MAY INCLUDE PERFORMANCE MEASURES DISAGGREGATED BY DEMOGRAPHIC GROUP, SUCH AS RECIPIENCY RATE, TIMELINESS OF ISSUING PAYMENTS, AND QUALITY OF BENEFIT ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS.INTENDED BENEFICIARIES  STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIESSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES  NOT APPLICABLE

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT IS TO PROVIDE DISASTER UNEMPLOYMENT ASSISTANCE (DUA) BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED WORKERS OR UNEMPLOYED SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS AS DEFINED AT 20 CFR 625.2 AND THAT THE UNEMPLOYMENT IS CAUSED BY A MAJOR DISASTER AS PROVIDED IN 20 CFR 625.5. ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  PROVIDE DUA BENEFITS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER AND ARE NOT ELIGIBLE FOR UNEMPLOYMENT COMPENSATION BUT MEET THE DUA QUALIFYING REQUIREMENTS.     EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  THE DUA PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY PARTIAL INCOME REPLACEMENT SO INDIVIDUALS UNEMPLOYED AS A RESULT OF A DECLARED DISASTER CAN PROVIDE FOR THE NECESSITIES OF LIVING.  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  UNEMPLOYED OR PARTIALLY UNEMPLOYED WORKERS, OR SELF-EMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER OR HAVE BEEN PREVENTED FROM COMMENCING EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT. THIS INCLUDES INDIVIDUALS WHO RESIDE IN THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA BUT ARE UNABLE TO REACH THEIR PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT OUTSIDE OF THE MAJOR DISASTER AREA, AND INDIVIDUALS WHO MUST TRAVEL THROUGH A MAJOR DISASTER AREA TO THEIR EMPLOYMENT OR SELF-EMPLOYMENT, BUT WHO ARE UNABLE TO DO SO AS A DIRECT RESULT OF THE MAJOR DISASTER.SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO SUBAWARD FUNDS.

ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  ACTIVITIES WILL CENTER AROUND IMPROVING AWARENESS OF THE PROGRAM, ESPECIALLY IN COMMUNITIES WITH BARRIERS TO ACCESS  IMPROVING SERVICE DELIVERY THROUGH THE APPLICATION PROCESS AND IN GENERAL  AND DEVELOPING A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE EQUITY CHALLENGES THAT NEED TO BE ADDRESSED.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  OUTCOMES WILL BE NEGOTIATED AS PART OF THE GRANT APPLICATION PROCESS PRIOR TO THE APPROVAL OF FUNDS AND MAY INCLUDE PERFORMANCE MEASURES DISAGGREGATED BY DEMOGRAPHIC GROUP, SUCH AS RECIPIENCY RATE, TIMELINESS OF ISSUING PAYMENTS, AND QUALITY OF BENEFIT ELIGIBILITY DETERMINATIONS.   INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIESSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  NOT APPLICABLE

TIGER GRANT AWARDS DESCRIPTION:PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THESE GRANT FUNDS IS TO HELP STATES IMPLEMENT IDENTIFIED RECOMMENDATIONS IN AREAS THE STATE NEEDS TO CHANGE CORRECT TO MEET ARPA GOALS.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED:  STATES MUST COMPLETE AN ASSESSMENT THAT LEVERAGES A MULTI-DISCIPLINARY APPROACH RELATED TO IDENTIFYING PROCESS IMPROVEMENTS AND IMPLEMENT NEGOTIATED RECOMMENDATIONS IDENTIFIED BY THE DEPARTMENTS TIGER TEAM ENGAGEMENT ASSESSMENT.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:  DETECT AND PREVENT FRAUD, PROMOTE EQUITABLE ACCESS, AND ENSURE THE TIMELY PAYMENT OF BENEFITS (INCLUDING REDUCTION ELIMINATION OF ADJUDICATION AND APPEALS BACKLOGS).  INTENDED BENEFICIARIES:  STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIESSUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES:  NOT APPLICABLE
